name: narcissus-cyclamineus
particularly-resistant-to-insects/diseas: Resistant to pest and disease problems
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
flower-description: Flowers are scapose, dropping to pendent, 2-3" in diameter, and are subtended by a one-valved membranous spathe. Flowers have a perianth tubular base with 6 segments. The perianth segments are yellow, sharply reflexed, elliptic, and entire. The corona is yellow, conspicuous, in the form of a long and slender tube, 12-lobed fimbriate, and slightly constricted just below the flared margin. Flowers bloom in early spring.
leaf-description: Leaves are basal, strap-like, entire, erect, bright green, and less than an inch wide.
poison-symptoms: Vomiting, salvation, diarrhea; large ingestions cause convulsions, low blood pressure, tremors, and cardiac arrhythmias. Bulbs are the most poisonous part
